1 /*!
  2  * Hasher <http://github.com/millermedeiros/Hasher>
  3  * Includes: MM.EventDispatcher (0.8), MM.queryUtils (0.7), MM.event-listenerFacade (0.3)
  4  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
  5  * @version 0.9.4 (2010/07/27)
  6  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
  7  */
  8 /*
  9  * MM.EventDispatcher
 10  * - Class used to allow Custom Objects to dispatch events.
 11  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
 12  * @version 0.8.1 (2010/07/27)
 13  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
 14  */
 15 
 16 /**
 17  * @namespace Miller Medeiros namespace
 18  */
 19 var MM = MM || {};
 20 
 21 /**
 22  * EventDispatcher Object, used to allow Custom Objects to dispatch events.
 23  * @constructor
 24  */
 25 MM.EventDispatcher = function(){
 26 	this._handlers = {};
 27 };
 28 
 29 MM.EventDispatcher.prototype = {
 30 	
 31 	/**
 32 	 * Add Event Listener
 33 	 * @param {String} eType	Event Type.
 34 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 35 	 */
 36 	addEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 37 		if(typeof this._handlers[eType] == 'undefined'){
 38 			this._handlers[eType] = [];
 39 		}
 40 		this._handlers[eType].push(fn);
 41 	},
 42 	
 43 	/**
 44 	 * Remove Event Listener
 45 	 * @param {String} eType	Event Type.
 46 	 * @param {Function} fn	Event Handler.
 47 	 */
 48 	removeEventListener : function(eType, fn){
 49 		if(! this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 50 			return;
 51 		}
 52 		var	typeHandlers = this._handlers[eType], //stored for performance
 53 			n = typeHandlers.length;
 54 		if(n == 1){
 55 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 56 		}else{
 57 			while(n--){ //faster than for
 58 				if(typeHandlers[n] == fn){
 59 					typeHandlers.splice(n, 1);
 60 					break;
 61 				}
 62 			}
 63 		}
 64 	},
 65 	
 66 	/**
 67 	 * Removes all Listeners from the EventDispatcher object.
 68 	 * @param {(String|Boolean)} eType	Event type or `true` if want to remove listeners of all event types.
 69 	 */
 70 	removeAllEventListeners : function(eType){
 71 		if(eType === true){
 72 			this._handlers = {};
 73 		}else if(this.hasEventListener(eType)){
 74 			delete this._handlers[eType];
 75 		}
 76 	},
 77 	
 78 	/**
 79 	 * Checks if the EventDispatcher has any listeners registered for a specific type of event. 
 80 	 * @param {String} eType	Event Type.
 81 	 * @return {Boolean}
 82 	 */
 83 	hasEventListener : function(eType){
 84 		return (typeof this._handlers[eType] != 'undefined');
 85 	},
 86 
 87 	/**
 88 	 * Dispatch Event
 89 	 * - Call all Handlers Listening to the Event.
 90 	 * @param {Event|String} evt	Custom Event Object (property `type` is required) or String with Event type.
 91 	 * @return {Boolean} If Event was successfully dispatched.
 92 	 */
 93 	dispatchEvent : function(evt){
 94 		evt = (typeof evt == 'string')? {type: evt} : evt; //create Object if not an Object to always call handlers with same type of argument.
 95 		if(this.hasEventListener(evt.type)){
 96 			var typeHandlers = this._handlers[evt.type], //stored for performance
 97 				curHandler,
 98 				i,
 99 				n = typeHandlers.length;
100 			evt.target = evt.target || this; //ensure Event.target exists
101 			for(i=0; i<n; i++){
102 				curHandler = typeHandlers[i];
103 				curHandler(evt);
104 			}
105 			return true;
106 		}
107 		return false;
108 	}
109 	
110 };
111 /*
112  * MM.queryUtils
113  * - utilities for query string manipulation
114  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
115  * @version 0.7 (2010/06/22)
116  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
117  */
118 
119 /**
120  * @namespace Miller Medeiros namespace
121  */
122 var MM = MM || {};
123 
124 /**
125  * @namespace Utilities for query string manipulation.
126  */
127 MM.queryUtils = {
128 	
129 	/**
130 	 * Gets full query as string with all special chars decoded.
131 	 * @param {String} [url]	 URL to be parsed, defaults to `location.href`
132 	 * @return {String}	Query string
133 	 */
134 	getQueryString : function(url){
135 		url = url || location.href; //used location.href to avoid bug on IE6 and pseudo query string inside location.hash
136 		url = url.replace(/#[\w\W]*/, ''); //removes hash (to avoid getting hash query)
137 		var queryString = /\?[a-zA-Z0-9\=\&\%\$\-\_\.\+\!\*\'\(\)\,]+/.exec(url); //valid chars according to: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
138 		return (queryString)? decodeURIComponent(queryString[0]) : '';
139 	},
140 	
141 	/**
142 	 * Gets query as Object.
143 	 * - Alias for `MM.queryUtils.toQueryObject( MM.queryUtils.getQueryString(url) )`
144 	 * @param {String} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href.
145 	 * @return {Object}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
146 	 */
147 	getQueryObject : function(url){
148 		return this.toQueryObject(this.getQueryString(url));
149 	},
150 	
151 	/**
152 	 * Convert Query String into an Object
153 	 * @param {String} queryString	 Query String to be parsed
154 	 * @return {Object}	Object with all the query "params => values" pairs.
155 	 */
156 	toQueryObject : function(queryString){
157 		var queryArr = queryString.replace('?', '').split('&'), 
158 			n = queryArr.length,
159 			queryObj = {};
160 		while (n--) {
161 			queryArr[n] = queryArr[n].split('=');
162 			queryObj[queryArr[n][0]] = queryArr[n][1];
163 		}
164 		return queryObj;
165 	},
166 	
167 	/**
168 	 * Get query parameter value.
169 	 * @param {String} param	Parameter name.
170 	 * @param {String} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
171 	 * @return {String}	Parameter value.
172 	 */
173 	getParamValue : function(param, url){
174 		return this.getQueryObject(url)[param];
175 	},
176 	
177 	/**
178 	 * Checks if query contains parameter.
179 	 * @param {String} param	Parameter name.
180 	 * @param {String} [url]	URL to be parsed, default to location.href
181 	 * @return {Boolean} If parameter exist.
182 	 */
183 	hasParam : function(param, url){
184 		var regexp = new RegExp('(\\?|&)'+ param +'=', 'g'); //matches `?param=` or `¶m=`
185 		return regexp.test(this.getQueryString(url));
186 	},
187 	
188 	/**
189 	 * Converts object into query string.
190 	 * @param {Object} obj	Object with "params => values" pairs.
191 	 * @return {String}	Formated query string starting with '?'.
192 	 */
193 	toQueryString : function(obj){
194 		var query = [],
195 			param;
196 		for(param in obj){
197 			if(obj.hasOwnProperty(param)){ //avoid copying properties from the prototype
198 				query.push(param +'='+ obj[param]);
199 			}
200 		}
201 		return (query.length)? '?'+ query.join('&') : '';
202 	}
203 	
204 };
205 /*
206  * MM.event - DOM Event Listener Facade
207  * - Cross-browser DOM Event Listener attachment/detachment.
208  * - Based on Peter-Paul Koch addEventSimple <http://www.quirksmode.org/js/eventSimple.html>
209  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
210  * @version 0.3 (2010/06/23)
211  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
212  */
213 
214 /**
215  * @namespace Miller Medeiros Namespace
216  */
217 var MM = MM || {};
218 
219 /**
220  * @namespace Utilities for Browser Native Events
221  */
222 MM.event = MM.event || {};
223 
224 /**
225 * Adds DOM Event Listener
226 * @param {Element} elm Element.
227 * @param {String} eType Event type.
228 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
229 */
230 MM.event.addListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
231 	if(elm.addEventListener){
232 		elm.addEventListener(eType, fn, false);
233 	}else if(elm.attachEvent){
234 		elm.attachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
235 	}else{
236 		elm['on' + eType] = fn;
237 	}
238 };
239 
240 /**
241 * Removes DOM Event Listener
242 * @param {Element} elm Element.
243 * @param {String} eType Event type.
244 * @param {Function} fn Listener function.
245 */
246 MM.event.removeListener = function(elm, eType, fn){
247 	if(elm.removeEventListener){
248 		elm.removeEventListener(eType, fn, false);
249 	}else if(elm.detachEvent){
250 		elm.detachEvent('on' + eType, fn);
251 	}else{
252 		elm['on' + eType] = null;
253 	}
254 };
255 /*
256  * Hasher Event
257  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
258  * @version 0.2 (2010/04/18)
259  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
260  */
261 
262 /**
263  * HasherEvent Object.
264  * <p>According to the HTML5 spec `hashchange` event should have `oldURL` and `newURL` properties, since the only portion of the URL that changes is the hash I decided to use `oldHash` and `newHash` instead. (http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/history.html#event-hashchange)</p>
265  * @param {String} eType	Hasher Event type.
266  * @param {String} oldHash	Previous Hash.
267  * @param {String} newHash	Current Hash.
268  * @constructor
269  */
270 var HasherEvent = function(eType, oldHash, newHash){
271 	/**
272 	 * Event Type
273 	 * @type String
274 	 */
275 	this.type = eType;
276 	/**
277 	 * Previous Hash value
278 	 * @type String
279 	 */
280 	this.oldHash = oldHash;
281 	/**
282 	 * Current Hash value
283 	 * @type String
284 	 */
285 	this.newHash = newHash;
286 };
287 
288 /**
289  * Returns string representation of the HasherEvent
290  * @return {String} A string representation of the object.
291  */
292 HasherEvent.prototype.toString = function(){
293 	return '[HasherEvent type="'+ this.type +'" oldHash="'+ this.oldHash +'" newHash="'+ this.newHash +'"]';
294 };
295 
296 //-- Constants --//
297 
298 /**
299  * Defines the value of the type property of an change event object.
300  * @type String
301  * @constant
302  */
303 HasherEvent.CHANGE = 'change';
304 
305  /**
306  * Defines the value of the type property of an init event object.
307  * @type String
308  * @constant
309  */
310 HasherEvent.INIT = 'init';
311 
312 /**
313  * Defines the value of the type property of an stop event object.
314  * @type String
315  * @constant
316  */
317 HasherEvent.STOP = 'stop';
318 /*
319  * Hasher
320  * - History Manager for rich-media applications.
321  * @author Miller Medeiros <http://www.millermedeiros.com/>
322  * @version 0.9.4 (2010/07/27)
323  * Released under the MIT License <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php>
324  */
325 (function(window, document, location, history, undef){
326 	
327 	
328 	//== Private Vars ==//
329 	
330 		/** @private {String} previous/current hash value */
331 	var _hash, 
332 		
333 		/** @private {Number} stores setInterval reference (used to check if hash changed on non-standard browsers) */
334 		_checkInterval,
335 		
336 		/** @private {Boolean} If Hasher is active and should listen/dispatch changes on the hash */
337 		_isActive,
338 		
339 		/** @private {iframe} iframe used for IE <= 7 */
340 		_frame,
341 		
342 		/** @private {String} User Agent */
343 		UA = navigator.userAgent,
344 		
345 		/** @private {Boolean} if is IE */
346 		_isIE = /MSIE/.test(UA)  && (!window.opera),
347 		
348 		/** @private {Boolean} if is IE <= 7 */
349 		_isLegacyIE = /MSIE (6|7)/.test(UA) && (!+"\v1"), //feature detection based on Andrea Giammarchi's solution: http://webreflection.blogspot.com/2009/01/32-bytes-to-know-if-your-browser-is-ie.html
350 		
351 		/** @private {Boolean} If browser supports the `hashchange` event - FF3.6+, IE8+, Chrome 5+, Safari 5+ */
352 		_isHashChangeSupported = ('onhashchange' in window),
353 		
354 		/** @private {Boolean} If it is a local file */
355 		_isLocal = (location.protocol === 'file:'),
356 		
357 		//-- local storage for performance improvement and better compression --//
358 		
359 		/** @private {Object} @extends MM.EventDispatcher */
360 		Hasher = new MM.EventDispatcher(),
361 		
362 		/** @private {MM.queryUtils} Utilities for query string manipulation */
363 		_queryUtils = MM.queryUtils,
364 		
365 		/** @private {MM.event} Browser native events adapter */
366 		_eventAdapter = MM.event;
367 		
368 	
369 	//== Private methods ==//
370 	
371 	/**
372 	 * Get hash value stored inside iframe
373 	 * - used for IE <= 7. [HACK] 
374 	 * @return {String}	Hash value without '#'.
375 	 */
376 	function _getFrameHash(){
377 		return (_frame)? _frame.contentWindow.frameHash : null;
378 	}
379 	
380 	/**
381 	 * Update iframe content, generating a history record and saving current hash/title on IE <= 7. [HACK]
382 	 * - based on Really Simple History, SWFAddress and YUI.history solutions.
383 	 * @param {string} hashValue	Hash value without '#'.
384 	 * @private
385 	 */
386 	function _updateFrame(hashValue){
387 		if(_frame && hashValue != _getFrameHash()){
388 			var frameDoc = _frame.contentWindow.document;
389 			frameDoc.open();
390 			frameDoc.write('<html><head><title>' + Hasher.getTitle() + '</title><script type="text/javascript">var frameHash="' + hashValue + '";</script></head><body> </body></html>'); //stores current hash inside iframe.
391 			frameDoc.close();
392 		}
393 	}
394 	
395 	/**
396 	 * Stores new hash value and dispatch `HasherEvent.CHANGE` if Hasher is "active".
397 	 * @param {String} newHash	New Hash Value.
398 	 * @private
399 	 */
400 	function _registerChange(newHash){
401 		if(_hash != newHash){
402 			var tmpHash = _hash;
403 			_hash = newHash; //should come before event dispatch to make sure user can get proper value inside event handler
404 			if(_isLegacyIE){
405 				_updateFrame(newHash);
406 			}
407 			if(_isActive){
408 				Hasher.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.CHANGE, tmpHash, newHash));
409 			}
410 		}
411 	}
412 	
413 	/**
414 	 * Creates iframe used to record history state on IE <= 7. [HACK]
415 	 * @private
416 	 */
417 	function _createFrame(){
418 		_frame = document.createElement('iframe');
419 		_frame.src = 'about:blank';
420 		_frame.style.display = 'none';
421 		document.body.appendChild(_frame);
422 	}
423 	
424 	/**
425 	 * Get hash value from current URL
426 	 * @return {String}	Hash value without '#'.
427 	 * @private
428 	 */
429 	function _getWindowHash(){
430 		//parsed full URL instead of getting location.hash because Firefox decode hash value (and all the other browsers don't)
431 		//also because of IE8 bug with hash query in local file [issue #6]
432 		var result = /#(.*)$/.exec( Hasher.getURL() );
433 		return (result && result[1])? decodeURIComponent( result[1] ) : '';
434 	}
435 	
436 	/**
437 	 * Checks if hash/history state has changed and dispatch HasherEvent.
438 	 * @private
439 	 */
440 	function _checkHistory(){
441 		var curHash = _getWindowHash();
442 		if(curHash != _hash){
443 			_registerChange(curHash);
444 		}
445 	}
446 	
447 	/**
448 	 * Check if browser history state has changed on IE <= 7. [HACK]
449 	 * - used since IE 6,7 doesn't generates new history record on hashchange.
450 	 * @private
451 	 */
452 	function _checkHistoryLegacyIE(){
453 		var windowHash = _getWindowHash(),
454 			frameHash = _getFrameHash();
455 		if(frameHash != _hash && frameHash != windowHash){ //detect changes made pressing browser history buttons. Workaround since history.back() and history.forward() doesn't update hash value on IE6/7 but updates content of the iframe.
456 			Hasher.setHash(frameHash);
457 		}else if(windowHash != _hash){ //detect if hash changed (manually or using setHash)
458 			_registerChange(windowHash);
459 		}
460 	}
461 	
462 	
463 	//== Public (API) ==//
464 	
465 	/**
466 	 * Hasher
467 	 * @namespace History Manager for rich-media applications.
468 	 * @extends MM.EventDispatcher
469 	 */
470 	this.Hasher = Hasher; //register Hasher to the global scope
471 	
472 	/**
473 	 * Start listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
474 	 */
475 	Hasher.init = function(){
476 		if(_isActive){
477 			return;
478 		}
479 		
480 		var tmpHash = _hash;
481 		_hash = _getWindowHash();
482 		
483 		//thought about branching/overloading Hasher.init() to avoid checking multiple times but don't think worth doing it since it probably won't be called multiple times. [?] 
484 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
485 			_eventAdapter.addListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
486 		}else { 
487 			if(_isLegacyIE){
488 				if(!_frame){
489 					_createFrame();
490 					_updateFrame(_hash);
491 				}
492 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistoryLegacyIE, 25);
493 			}else{
494 				_checkInterval = setInterval(_checkHistory, 25);
495 			}
496 		}
497 		
498 		_isActive = true;
499 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.INIT, tmpHash, _hash));
500 	};
501 	
502 	/**
503 	 * Stop listening/dispatching changes in the hash/history.
504 	 */
505 	Hasher.stop = function(){
506 		if(!_isActive){
507 			return;
508 		}
509 		
510 		if(_isHashChangeSupported){
511 			_eventAdapter.removeListener(window, 'hashchange', _checkHistory);
512 		}else{
513 			clearInterval(_checkInterval);
514 			_checkInterval = null;
515 		}
516 		
517 		_isActive = false;
518 		this.dispatchEvent(new HasherEvent(HasherEvent.STOP, _hash, _hash)); //since it didn't changed oldHash and newHash should be the same. [?]
519 	};
520 	
521 	/**
522 	 * Retrieve full URL.
523 	 * @return {String}	Full URL.
524 	 */
525 	Hasher.getURL = function(){
526 		return location.href;
527 	};
528 	
529 	/**
530 	 * Retrieve URL without query string and hash.
531 	 * @return {String}	Base URL.
532 	 */
533 	Hasher.getBaseURL = function(){
534 		return this.getURL().replace(/(\?.*)|(\#.*)/, ''); //removes everything after '?' and/or '#'
535 	};
536 	
537 	/**
538 	 * Set Hash value.
539 	 * @param {String} value	Hash value without '#'.
540 	 */
541 	Hasher.setHash = function(value){
542 		value = (value)? value.replace(/^\#/, '') : value; //removes '#' from the beginning of string.
543 		if(value != _hash){
544 			_registerChange(value); //avoid breaking the application if for some reason `location.hash` don't change (not sure if really needed but it's safer to keep it).
545 			if(_isIE && _isLocal){
546 				value = value.replace(/\?/, '%3F'); //fix IE8 local file bug [issue #6]
547 			}
548 			location.hash = '#'+ encodeURI(value); //used encodeURI instead of encodeURIComponent to preserve '?', '/', '#'. Fixes Safari bug [issue #8]
549 		}
550 	};
551 	
552 	/**
553 	 * Return hash value as String.
554 	 * @return {String}	Hash value without '#'.
555 	 */
556 	Hasher.getHash = function(){
557 		//didn't used actual value of the `location.hash` to avoid breaking the application in case `location.hash` isn't available. 
558 		return _hash;
559 	};
560 	
561 	/**
562 	 * Return hash value as Array.
563 	 * @param {String} [separator]	String used to divide hash (default = '/').	
564 	 * @return {Array}	Hash splitted into an Array.  
565 	 */
566 	Hasher.getHashAsArray = function(separator){
567 		separator = separator || '/';
568 		var hash = this.getHash(),
569 			regexp = new RegExp('^\\'+ separator +'|\\'+ separator +'$', 'g'); //match separator at the end or begin of string
570 		hash = hash.replace(regexp, '');
571 		return hash.split(separator);
572 	};
573 	
574 	/**
575 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as a String
576 	 * - alias to: `MM.queryUtils.getQueryString( Hasher.getHash() ).substr(1);`
577 	 * @return {String}	Hash Query without '?'
578 	 */
579 	Hasher.getHashQuery = function(){
580 		return _queryUtils.getQueryString( this.getHash() ).substr(1);
581 	};
582 	
583 	/**
584 	 * Get Query portion of the Hash as an Object
585 	 * - alias to: `MM.queryUtils.toQueryObject( Hasher.getHashQueryString() );`
586 	 * @return {Object} Hash Query
587 	 */
588 	Hasher.getHashQueryAsObject = function(){
589 		return _queryUtils.toQueryObject( this.getHashQuery() );
590 	};
591 	
592 	/**
593 	 * Get parameter value from the query portion of the Hash
594 	 * - alias to: `MM.queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, Hasher.getHash() );`
595 	 * @param {String} paramName	Parameter Name.
596 	 * @return {String}	Parameter value.
597 	 */
598 	Hasher.getHashQueryParam = function(paramName){
599 		return _queryUtils.getParamValue(paramName, this.getHash() );
600 	};
601 	
602 	/**
603 	 * Set page title
604 	 * @param {String} value	Page Title
605 	 */
606 	Hasher.setTitle = function(value){
607 		document.title = value;
608 	};
609 	
610 	/**
611 	 * Get page title
612 	 * @return {String} Page Title
613 	 */
614 	Hasher.getTitle = function(){
615 		return document.title;
616 	};
617 	
618 	/**
619 	 * Navigate to previous page in history
620 	 */
621 	Hasher.back = function(){
622 		history.back();
623 	};
624 	
625 	/**
626 	 * Navigate to next page in history
627 	 */
628 	Hasher.forward = function(){
629 		history.forward();
630 	};
631 	
632 	/**
633 	 * Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page.
634 	 * - for example `-1` loads previous page, `1` loads next page.
635 	 * @param {int} delta	Relative location to the current page.
636 	 */
637 	Hasher.go = function(delta){
638 		history.go(delta);
639 	};
640 	
641 }(window, document, location, history));
642
